Until the moment Meghan Markle walked down the aisle on her wedding day all eyes had been firmly on Amal Clooney.

The wedding guest fashion stakes were high, with the likes of Victoria Beckham, Serena Williams and Priyanka Chopra all in attendance at St George's Chapel, but it was 40-year-old Amal who topped the best dressed list.

The human rights lawyer stole the show in a canary yellow ensemble by Stella McCartney. The midi dress featured cap sleeves and an elegant side drape, making it the perfect mix of classic and contemporary. She finished off the statement outfit with a matching hat complete with net veil by Stephen Jones.

Just days after the wedding Google searches for 'Amal Clooney Royal Wedding' had already racked up over 479,000 results. A sartorial success indeed!

Now, finally, you can recreate the look, as the designer behind the show-stopping number, Stella McCartney, has released the design. The dress also stays true to McCartney's ethical principles and is made out of sustainable viscose, acetate and silk lining.

The 'Angie Dress', of course, comes with a luxury price tag and will set you back £1,250.

The dress is also available on Matches Fashion, which has aptly renamed it the 'Amal tie-back crepe dress'. But it's selling out fast with only one size left in stock.

If you have a spring wedding fast approaching or are still in need of a lasting look to ring in the New Year, this dress is sure to be a winner.
